venue.name: Mt Cabot Via The N. Unknown Pond TH

item.description:
This hike to Mt Cabot will start on the Millbrook Rd, Stark, NH/ North Unknown Pond trail,including the trail-less Unknown Pond Peak, this route takes in the classic reflecting-pool view of the Horn from Unknown Pond, and also climbs the Horn itself, which provides the best views in the Pilot-Pliny Range.



Unknown Pond Peak is on the New Hampshire 100 Highest list, which is just east of the pond on Kilkenny trail and the campsite on a southern spur. then back over the Horn and the Bulge (two peaks on the NE Hundred Highest list) to Mt. Cabot, elevation 4,170 feet, by the Kilkenny Ridge trail, returning by Bunnell Notch trail(lp: 10.9 miles, 2,800 feet, 6:50).

Directions : trailhead is on Mill Brook Rd. (FR 11) 4.5 mi. south of NH 110. There is a sign (hiker symbol) on NH 110 at the beginning of Mill Brook Rd. and a trail sign at the trailhead, which is just east of a bridge across Mill Brook. Parking is available beyond the bridge on the right




Mt. Cabot is the most northerly 4000 footer in New Hampshire. Please add time to your driving trip to arrive on time.

We would like to see at least 3 "yes" RSVP's to create a meetup. Your assistance on the trail is always welcome and helps in making a Meetup

Please keep your rsvp's up to date. Its very important that we have a true headcount, and not worry that your late or lost. Every hiker is important on a hike, especially if we divide the hike into a fast and slow group, or if there is an injury. Waiting for the group at junctions and difficult sections is the rule and makes for a better hike.


Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the NEHAAG disclaimer.

Make sure your hiker profile is complete so we can verify that your qualified to join us on this White Mountain hike.

Carpooling is always advised and a great way to get to know your fellow members.
item.name: Mt Cabot Via The North Unknown Pond Trailhead
